news.title: ‘You can only imagine the knock on the door for those families’ – five young friends die in nation’s worst road tragedy for 15 years
news.summary: Five young friends died and three others were left injured after a horrific two-car collision that left one vehicle engulfed in flames.

news.title: Sinn Féin politician knew about criminal past of party activist now suspected of far-right extremism
news.summary: A Sinn Féin senator was aware of the criminal convictions of a supporter who is now a terror suspect in a far-right plot to attack a mosque.

news.title: Eamonn Sweeney: Thank you Heimir Hallgrimsson and the lads for the four days which shook the Irish sporting world
news.summary: This was the Irish victory to beat them all. Did you ever see the likes of it?

news.title: ‘Fraudsters stole €2,400 from my Revolut account while I was asleep – but they still told me I must have authorised it myself’
news.summary: A father who had €2,400 stolen from his Revolut account has criticised the “frustrating” experience he had trying to get a refund.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Incompetence or expedience? Why Simon Harris’s scoliosis promise must be scrutinised in inquiry
news.summary: Any parent of young children will feel their hearts go out to the parents of Harvey Morrison Sherratt. Stephen Morrison and Gillian Sherratt lost their beautiful son this summer at the age of just nine.

news.title: Keeping Dublin moving through the night: Inside Dublin Bus’s 24-hour network
news.summary: For many Dubliners, a night out or an early-morning shift often begins or ends on a bus.

news.title: Uncertainty globally and tariffs likely to prompt spending fall in Irish economy
news.summary: The Irish economy is expected to see growth continue into next year but the pace will be slowed by continued global uncertainty and an expected pull-back in spending by increasingly nervous consumers.

news.title: I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! review: No local interest for the Irish yet but the show wisely goes back to basics
news.summary: The BBC may be run these days by woke activists prepared to trash the corporation’s hard won reputation just to score a few points over their ideological enemies on the right, but at least there are no ads.

news.title: Ask Allison: My son’s best friend has trouble regulating his feelings and it’s affecting my son – what do I do?
news.summary: Question:  My nine-year-old son has a best friend since he was in nursery school. They were always very close and I also have a friendship with the boy’s mother, as we have younger children the same age and the boys were both our first.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Troubled Waters Ep 1 – ‘They’re messing with his head’: Paul Kimmage’s journey inside the toxic world of Irish rowing
news.summary: In part one of our special investigation, we examine the concerns raised about the culture inside Irish rowing’s High Performance Unit.
